column4: Hey where is compiz on 10.04>?  it says installed but i cant find it
you'll prolly want to install the "compizconfig-settings-manager"  or whatever it's called, might have a hyphen in the wrong place
then how can you possibly remove windows?
just use gparted, like i said
gparted has everything you need to know... how many partitions does it show, what's on each of them, and how large is each one??
i don't use wubi, and neither should you if you don't use windows... i'd also get rid of that windows recovery partition as well
don't use wubi is all you need to know
yes, you already answered your own question
what was it that you said you should do, again?
thats not true. having sex with a dinosaur is impossible.
i just raped my gecko yesterday
some questions are best left to google
learning how to research is the first part to becoming a man instead of a bot
